intro: Phacelia aldersonii, commonly known as the Alderson's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in desert regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and blooms during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
